name: Newborn (0-3 months)
description: Focus on bonding, feeding, sleep patterns, and early sensory development. Babies begin to recognize faces and respond to sounds.

name: Infant (3-6 months)
description: Increased alertness, rolling over, grasping objects, and social smiling. Beginning of babbling and stronger neck control.

name: Infant (6-9 months)
description: Sitting independently, crawling begins, first teeth, stranger anxiety, and understanding of object permanence.

name: Infant (9-12 months)
description: Pulling to stand, cruising furniture, first words, pincer grasp, and increased independence in feeding.

name: Toddler (1-2 years)
description: Walking, rapid vocabulary growth, parallel play, asserting independence, and beginning of emotional regulation.

name: Toddler (2-3 years)
description: Running, climbing, toilet training, two-word sentences, imaginative play, and understanding of basic rules.

name: Preschool (3-4 years)
description: Complex sentences, cooperative play, self-care skills, pre-literacy, and developing empathy and friendships.

name: Preschool (4-5 years)
description: School readiness, letter recognition, counting, following multi-step instructions, and emotional self-regulation.

name: Early Elementary (5-7 years)
description: Learning to read and write, basic math, structured learning, team activities, and developing sense of right and wrong.

name: Middle Elementary (7-9 years)
description: Reading fluency, logical thinking, peer relationships become central, organized sports, and growing independence.

name: Late Elementary (9-11 years)
description: Abstract thinking begins, strong friendships, interest in hobbies, beginning of puberty awareness, and increased responsibility.

name: Early Adolescence (11-14 years)
description: Puberty, identity exploration, peer influence peaks, middle school transition, and developing critical thinking.

name: Middle Adolescence (14-16 years)
description: High school, romantic interests, career exploration, driving, increased autonomy, and value system development.

name: Late Adolescence (16-18 years)
description: College/career preparation, adult relationships, financial literacy, life skills, and transition to independence.
